alert.note: Alert for Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 8:19PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BLOUNT...NORTHEASTERN MONROE AND SOUTH CENTRAL SEVIER COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 919 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockford to near Eagleton Village to 10 miles northwest of Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area to near Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek to 14 miles west of Lake Santeetlah. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Maryville, Alcoa, Rockford, Eagleton Village, Smoky Mountains-Twentymile Creek, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Townsend, Tariffville, Walland, and Happy Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Morristown.

area.areaDesc: Blount Smoky Mountains; NW Blount; Northwest Monroe; Sevier Smoky Mountains; Southeast Monroe
